properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 6 at 12:57PM PST until January 7 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW TODAY AND TONIGHT FOR THE CASCADES...
NORTHEAST WASHINGTON...BLUE MOUNTAINS...AND THE IDAHO PANHANDLE...

.A storm system will linger over the region into tonight.
Moderate to heavy snow accumulations are expected over the Idaho
Panhandle and in the Cascades. Snow will transition to rain for
the Coeur D Alene Areas and Palouse this afternoon.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional mountain snow
accumulations 5 to 10 inches. Additional valley snow
accumulations up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph in
the mountains.

* WHERE...Sandpoint, Bonners Ferry, Priest River, Eastport,
Schweitzer Mountain Road, Kellogg, Pinehurst, Osburn, Wallace,
Mullan, Fourth of July Pass, Dobson Pass, and Lookout Pass.

* WHEN...Through 6 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Difficult travel is expected especially in the
mountains.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to change to rain late
this afternoon in the Silver Valley and this evening over the
northern Panhandle valleys. Moderate to heavy mountain snow is
expected to continue at times Tuesday into Wednesday morning.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST TUESDAY
